Eli Wiesel

Lean about Eli Wiesel’s
struggle through the Holocaust

Learn More!

“Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented” - Elie Wiesel

Eli Wiesel is a major figure of the Holocaust. He has written the famouse book “Night” and won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1986. The stories that were writtten by Eli himself are tremendous and touching to many.

Quotes

“There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.”

“The opposite of love is not hate, it is indifference.”

“We must always take sides.”
